description.narrative: 1) Additional and steady income for 5,000+ dairy farmers in the Oromiya region of Ethiopia. 2) Positive incentives for farmers to invest in their livestock and increase their yields. 3) Introduction of healthy, safe dairy products and a resulting increased food safety. 4) Large-scale employment (250+ full-time employees) as well as further jobs in the adjacent business areas. 5) Increased competition in the Ethiopian dairy industry. 6) Economic development of a sector of pivotal importance to rural and urban economic development.

The proposed investment consists of investment of up to 8 million to Velocity Dairy Plc (VD) through Velocity Africa Holding B.V. in support of its investment in a greenfield dairy operation in Ethiopia. VD was established in 2010 by Velocity Africa Holding BV to carry out this investment. The proposed investment will finance the construction of a modern dairy processing plant with a daily capacity of up to 70,000 liters, related infrastructure work, and the procurement of factory machinery and equipment. VD intends to produce dairy products and fruit juices to be marketed primarily in the local market. The proposed financing package will be supported by the Private Sector Window of the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP). GAFSP funding plays a catalytic role to create opportunity to support innovative private sector investments and deliver a level of additionality and impact beyond what is possible through IFCs regular operations.

mailing-address.narrative: Jacco Groot, Managing Director Velocity Africa Holding B.V. Email: mailto:jacco.groot@velocitycapital.nl Phone: +31-343-524-164

name.narrative: The project area is located in the Oromiya National Regional State in Ethiopia.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
